Articles.Content:
Windows 10, Microsofts latest and greatest.

In my opinion it's the best. (don't hate)

Pros of upgrading:

Easier to Navigate Around Windows 10

Faster Boot Times

Better UI (By Far)Ã¢â‚¬â€¹

Cortana

Microsoft Edge (An Amazing Browser, Just be Sure to Set Your Default Search Engine to Google)

Cons of upgrading:

Takes a few hours without a beast PC (to be expected, but still.)

Not all games will work with Win10 for a while. (KSP does tho so we're all good imo)

Can't think of any other cons.

Post what you think below.

-Kozak
It's like comparing Windows XP and Windows 7. Both are good, but you're used to use older one

My opinion is that Microsoft doesn't know how to count:

DOS

95

98

2000

ME

XP

Vista

7

8

8.1

10

4 of these aren't even numbers. And even if you take them out you're left with this:

95

98

2000

7

8

8.1

10

Since when does 2000 come before 7? Maybe if you're in negative numbers but these clearly don't have negative signs.

(For the record, I'm a Win7 Fan)

Windows 2000 was the year it was released. It's actual version number was 5.0. (It was preceded by Windows NT 4.0, not 98).

Windows XP was 5.1

Windows Vista was 6.0

Windows 98, and ME do not fall in the same category as the others. They were known as the 9x Kernal, where as modern Windows are based on the NT Kernal. They had an entirely different numbering system and their Kernal was very unstable, and got worse and worse till Microsoft decided to kill it. Windows 95 was not even an operating system at all. It was a program that ran on DOS like it's predecessor Windows 3.1.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-29T21:05:25Z" title="07/29/2015 09:05  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 29, 2015</time> by Alshain**
Windows 10 looks awesome and I can't wait to install it.

> Windows XP was 5.1

> Windows Vista was 6.0

> Windows 98, and ME do not fall in the same category as the others. They were known as the 9x Kernal, where as modern Windows are based on the NT Kernal. They had an entirely different numbering system and their Kernal was very unstable, and got worse and worse till Microsoft decided to kill it. Windows 95 was not even an operating system at all. It was a program that ran on DOS like it's predecessor Windows 3.1.
